You try to explain what has happened and how you have become Matt Damon, but she just looks at you crazily and does not believe you. She otherwise passes it off as an elaborate joke you are making, and suggests that you get ready to go to work.

Work, you ponder, it surely meant a film shoot, and not your usual job at the hospital. Your mind was racing trying to piece together this new reality you were thrust into, and you couldn't help but think that your were way over your head. Grabbing Matt Damon's smart phone, you noticed a missed call, who left a voicemail. The message was from your agent, Alex saying to get to the film shoot in about an hour as you are needed for an important shot. You then panic, as you get the address to the film set, and you head out. You drive in a car that you don't recognize, and get to the set on time.

There everyone seems relived to see you arrive, and they thrust you onto the set. You are told that your need to act for this film is very important, and the production company cannot stall any longer. You are then given little time to rehearse, and filming begins almost immediately. The performance you give feels mediocre to you, but the director and the rest of the crew find it satisfactory. The assure you that they will edit it to be much more engaging before it releases in films. You leave the set, and spend the rest of your day at Matt Damon's home.
